alert.note: Alert for Avery; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 26 at 3:15AM EST until December 27 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of western North Carolina, including the following areas, Avery, Burke Mountains, Caldwell Mountains, Eastern McDowell, Greater Burke, Greater Caldwell, McDowell Mountains, Mitchell and Yancey. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Deep moisture across the area and strong southeasterly low level flow will lead to heavy rainfall tonight. Isolated to scattered thunderstorms are also possible which could increase rainfall rates where they develop. 2 to 4 inches of rain has already fallen with additional amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected through tonight. This could lead to flooding, especially locations along and near the Blue Ridge Escarpment where upslope flow could enhance rainfall rates. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means there is a potential for rapid onset flooding based on current forecasts. Flash flooding is a very dangerous situation and may impact areas that do not typically flood. Please monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action quickly should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
